- C O R P O R A L C L E G G -
Words and Music by Roger Waters
al Clegg had a wooden leg.
He won it in the war in nineteen forty-four.
al Clegg had a medal, too,
In orange, red and blue. He found it in the zoo.
r, oh dear, oh, are they really sad for me?
oh, dear, oh, will they really laugh at me?
ssus Clegg, you must be proud of him.
ssus Clegg, another drop of gin?
al Clegg, umbrella in the rain.
He's never been the same. No one is to blame.
al Clegg, received his medal in a dream
>From Her Majesty, the Queen. His boots were very clean.
ssus Clegg, you must be proud of him.
ssus Clegg, another drop of gin?
